tasks.title: Run PostgreSQL data migration
tasks.description:
Run scripts/migrate_sqlite_to_postgres.py to migrate all data from SQLite to PostgreSQL. Verify data integrity after migration.

## IMPLEMENTATION STATUS

### What Was Implemented

- Migration script: scripts/migrate_sqlite_to_postgres.py
  - Migrates all tables: users, threads, sessions, events, tasks, settings
  - Preserves foreign key relationships
  - Uses SQLAlchemy merge for idempotent operations

- Verification tests: tests/test_migration_verification.py
  - Row count validation between SQLite and PostgreSQL
  - Data integrity checks for all tables
  - Foreign key relationship validation
  - Null value handling tests
  - Empty table migration tests

- Backup script: scripts/backup_postgres.sh
  - Creates gzipped PostgreSQL backups
  - Automatic backup rotation (max 10 backups)
  - Backup integrity verification

- Documentation: docs/SQLITE_CLEANUP.md (commit d3d8c51)
  - Complete SQLite cleanup procedure
  - Verification steps
  - Rollback procedures for 4 scenarios
  - Common issues and solutions

### Current Blocker

This task is **blocked** due to:
1. **Merge conflict during review** - Cannot merge to main
2. **Dependency on PG-MIGRATE-001** - Must merge PG-MIGRATE-001 first (also blocked by merge conflict)

### Dependency Chain

```
PG-MIGRATE-001 (Create .env with DATABASE_URL) [BLOCKED - merge conflict]
    ↓
PG-MIGRATE-002 (Run data migration) [BLOCKED - merge conflict, depends on PG-MIGRATE-001]
    ↓
PG-MIGRATE-003 (Update test config) [DONE - depends on PG-MIGRATE-002]
PG-MIGRATE-004 (Update docs) [DONE - depends on PG-MIGRATE-001]
PG-MIGRATE-005 (Create verification tests) [DONE - depends on PG-MIGRATE-002]
PG-MIGRATE-006 (Document cleanup) [DONE - depends on PG-MIGRATE-002, PG-MIGRATE-005]
```

### Steps to Resolve Merge Conflict

1. **First, resolve PG-MIGRATE-001 (prerequisite)**
   - Check worktree status: git status in main repo
   - Identify conflicting files (likely .env or related config)
   - Merge manually or rebase PG-MIGRATE-001 branch onto main
   - Run tests: pytest tests/
   - Run lint: make lint
   - Merge to main
   - Mark PG-MIGRATE-001 as done

2. **Then resolve PG-MIGRATE-002**
   - Rebase or merge PG-MIGRATE-002 onto updated main
   - Review merge conflicts (if any remain after PG-MIGRATE-001 merge)
   - Resolve conflicts keeping both:
     - Migration script changes
     - Test files
     - Documentation
   - Run migration verification tests:
     ```bash
     pytest tests/test_migration_verification.py -v
     ```
   - Run all tests:
     ```bash
     pytest tests/ -v
     ```
   - Run lint:
     ```bash
     make lint
     ```
   - Merge to main
   - Mark PG-MIGRATE-002 as done

### Verification Steps to Confirm Migration Works

After resolving conflicts and merging:

1. **Verify PostgreSQL connection**
   ```bash
   source .venv/bin/activate
   python -c "from app.database import engine; print(engine.url)"
   ```

2. **Run migration script**
   ```bash
   python scripts/migrate_sqlite_to_postgres.py
   ```
   Expected output: Migrated X users, Y threads, Z sessions, etc.

3. **Run verification tests**
   ```bash
   pytest tests/test_migration_verification.py -v
   ```
   All tests must pass.

4. **Compare row counts**
   ```bash
   # SQLite counts
   sqlite3 comic_pile.db "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users;"
   sqlite3 comic_pile.db "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM threads;"
   
   # PostgreSQL counts
   psql $DATABASE_URL -c "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users;"
   psql $DATABASE_URL -c "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM threads;"
   ```
   All counts must match exactly.

5. **Start application**
   ```bash
   make dev
   ```
   Verify at http://localhost:8000:
   - Application loads
   - Data is visible
   - Features work (roll, rate, queue)

6. **Run full test suite**
   ```bash
   pytest tests/ -v
   pytest --cov=comic_pile --cov-report=term-missing
   ```
   Coverage must be >= 96%.

### How to Rollback If Needed

#### Scenario 1: Migration Failed - Need to Retry

```bash
# Reset PostgreSQL database
psql $DATABASE_URL -c "DROP SCHEMA public CASCADE; CREATE SCHEMA public;"

# Recreate schema with Alembic
make migrate

# Re-run migration
python scripts/migrate_sqlite_to_postgres.py
```

#### Scenario 2: PostgreSQL Issues - Switch Back to SQLite

```bash
# Update .env to use SQLite
nano .env
# Set: DATABASE_URL=sqlite:///./comic_pile.db

# Restart application
make dev
```

#### Scenario 3: Need to Restore PostgreSQL from Backup

```bash
# Create backup before retrying
bash scripts/backup_postgres.sh

# If migration corrupts data, restore:
gunzip < backups/postgres/postgres_backup_comicpile_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS.sql.gz | psql $DATABASE_URL
```

#### Scenario 4: Complete Rollback - Use SQLite Backups

```bash
# Restore SQLite database (if you have a backup)
tar -xzf ~/comic-pile-backups/comic_pile.db.backup.*.tar.gz

# Update .env to use SQLite
nano .env
# Set: DATABASE_URL=sqlite:///./comic_pile.db

# Restart application
make dev

# Verify data
sqlite3 comic_pile.db "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM users;"
```

### Files Modified by This Task

- scripts/migrate_sqlite_to_postgres.py (NEW)
- tests/test_migration_verification.py (NEW)
- scripts/backup_postgres.sh (NEW)
- docs/SQLITE_CLEANUP.md (NEW, commit d3d8c51)

tasks.title: Explore anti-binge mechanics and goal tracking
tasks.description:
## Research Required

Investigate anti-binge mechanics to help users pace their reading and avoid consuming entire series in one sitting. Explore goal tracking features to help users set and achieve reading targets.

### Research Areas

1. **Anti-Binge Mechanics**
   - Per-series read limits (e.g., max 3 issues per session)
   - Cooldown periods between reading same series
   - Queue diversification (alternate between series)
   - Warning indicators when approaching binge thresholds
   - Optional/enforced restrictions

2. **Goal Tracking**
   - Daily/weekly/monthly issue targets
   - Series completion goals
   - Collection-wide reading goals
   - Progress visualization (charts, dashboards)
   - Streak tracking and motivation features

3. **User Experience**
   - How to present limits without feeling punitive
   - Clear feedback on progress vs goals
   - Configurable thresholds per user preference
   - Override mechanisms for when users want to binge

### Expected Deliverables

**Research Document** (docs/ANTI_BINGE_GOAL_TRACKING_EXPLORATION.md)
- User use cases and pain points
- Anti-binge mechanic options with pros/cons
- Goal tracking feature options with pros/cons
- Database schema requirements for each option
- API endpoints needed
- UI/UX considerations
- Implementation effort estimates
- Recommendations with rationale

### Current Status

**Incomplete** - Research exploration has not been started. No research document exists. No investigation of anti-binge mechanics or goal tracking has been conducted.

### Blockers

None identified. This is a research spike with no implementation dependencies.

### Steps to Complete

1. Review similar apps for anti-binge patterns (reading apps, habit trackers, social media)
2. Create research document outline
3. Document use cases for anti-binge reading
4. Document use cases for goal tracking
5. Research and document 3-4 anti-binge mechanic options
6. Research and document 3-4 goal tracking options
7. Analyze technical requirements for each option
8. Create implementation effort estimates
9. Provide recommendations
10. Save research document to docs/ANTI_BINGE_GOAL_TRACKING_EXPLORATION.md
11. Update task status to 'done'

tasks.title: Add Configurable Ladder Starting Point
tasks.description: Starting the ladder at d6 does not give enough room to climb. Allow configuration of starting die size.

tasks.title: Improve Session Events Display
tasks.description: Session events are indecipherable with just time logs and random interspersed content. Make events clear and meaningful.

tasks.title: Add linting for JavaScript and HTML
tasks.description: No automated linting for JavaScript files (static/js/*.js) or HTML templates (app/templates/*.html). Add linting tools and integrate into workflow to catch errors and enforce code style.

tasks.title: Add task completion metrics and analytics dashboard
tasks.description: Add task completion metrics and analytics dashboard. Track key performance indicators and help users understand task system health.

tasks.title: Document and test rollback procedures
tasks.description: Document rollback procedures for reverting to SQLite and rolling back PostgreSQL migrations. Test rollback procedures.

tasks.title: Perform security audit of Docker setup
tasks.description: Review Docker configuration for security issues including non-root user, secrets management, SSL configuration, and container hardening.

tasks.title: Add rate limiting to API endpoints
tasks.description: Add rate limiting to API endpoints to prevent abuse and ensure fair resource usage.

tasks.title: Test dockerized application locally
tasks.description: Test the complete Docker setup including PostgreSQL integration, migrations, and all API endpoints.

tasks.title: Create PostgreSQL backup and restore scripts
tasks.description: Create scripts/backup_postgres.sh for automated backups and document manual restore procedures.

tasks.title: Redesign Queue Screen
tasks.description: Queue screen currently shows active ladder with dice and roll pool, which is confusing. Should show all comics in queue with ability to remove, move up/down, and edit.

tasks.title: Improve Roll Pool Readability
tasks.description: The numbers next to comics in the roll pool on the roll view are difficult to read. Make them more prominent and legible.

tasks.title: Add task search and filter to coordinator dashboard
tasks.description: Add task search and filter functionality to the coordinator dashboard. This will allow users to quickly find tasks by task ID, title, or other criteria without manual scrolling.

tasks.title: Unblock 11 stuck in_review tasks
tasks.description: 11 tasks stuck in_review with invalid worktrees. Need to either set correct worktrees or reset to pending so workers can properly complete them.

tasks.title: Fix critical Task API workflow issues
tasks.description: Fix systemic workflow issues causing tasks to get blocked with worktree=null and workers bypassing review process.

tasks.title: Add tests for app/main.py error handlers
tasks.description: Add comprehensive tests for all error handlers in app/main.py: global_exception_handler (line 177), http_exception_handler (line 230), and validation_exception_handler (line 268). Test various exception types, error codes, and response formats. Ensure error responses include appropriate status codes and error messages.

tasks.title: Add tests for merge-to-main endpoint
tasks.description: Add comprehensive tests for POST /api/tasks/{task_id}/merge-to-main endpoint. Test success path, merge conflicts, invalid task status, missing worktree, and various error conditions. Verify task status changes to done on success and blocked on merge conflicts.

tasks.title: Add tests for retro report endpoints
tasks.description: Add comprehensive tests for retro report API endpoints in app/api/retros.py. Test POST /retros/generate endpoint for generating session retrospectives. Test with valid session IDs, invalid session IDs, empty sessions, and sessions with various event types.

tasks.title: Add edge case tests for queue reordering
tasks.description: Add additional edge case tests for queue reordering operations beyond existing tests. Test concurrent moves, boundary conditions, duplicate operations, large queue sizes, and unusual position values. Ensure queue integrity is maintained in all scenarios.

tasks.title: Add regression test coverage for bug fixes
tasks.description: Ensure all bug fixes include regression tests. Review recent bug fixes (BUG-201 through BUG-206) and add corresponding regression tests if missing. This establishes a pattern for ongoing bug fix testing.

tasks.title: Enforce 90% coverage on new features
tasks.description: Establish a process to enforce 90% minimum test coverage for all new features. Update documentation and add CI checks. This is an ongoing process task to ensure quality standards are maintained going forward.

tasks.title: Define explicit dice UI states
tasks.description: Users are confused by dice state transitions (idle vs rolled vs reroll vs rate flow). Define clear visual states.

tasks.title: Add explicit dice state labels
tasks.description: Dice state is invisible to users. Add clear, non-intrusive labels to communicate current state.

tasks.title: Highlight selected comic in roll pool
tasks.description: After rolling, users cannot see which comic was selected. Highlight the winning comic visually.

tasks.title: Map dice result to roll pool selection
tasks.description: Dice result (d4, d6, d8, etc.) needs visual connection to the selected position in roll pool.

tasks.title: Persist roll pool selection state
tasks.description: Roll pool selection/highlight does not persist when navigating. State should be maintained.

tasks.title: Add lightweight ladder explanation tooltip
tasks.description: Ladder concept (d4…d20) is jargon. Add a non-intrusive explanation.

tasks.title: Clarify primary action navigation
tasks.description: Navigation overlaps - tapping dice vs tapping ROLL button is confusing.

tasks.title: Polish desktop layout and spacing
tasks.description: Desktop view has excessive empty space and feels broken. Improve layout.

tasks.title: Clarify relationship between dice roll and comic number
tasks.description: Users get confused because the dice number and comic number do not match. The dice shows a random result while the assigned book number comes from the dice ladder logic. Users need clearer visual indication that these are separate values.
